Reviews.Title: Good for water sports
Reviews.Author: Reviewer in NJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this to take on a white-water rafting trip.  I got some great pictures on the trip.  A few had a small spot slightly smudged from a water spot on the lens, but that's not the camera's fault.  There was splashing throughout the ride down the rapids.  Most of the pictures were very good.  Some were great.  Previously I had used disposable cameras for water sports, but these pictures were infinitely better than those obtained with disposables.I also had my daughter take pictures with this on the rest of our vacation, while I used my Nikon D90.  She got plenty of good pictures, both in good light and at dusk as well.  As a point-and-shoot, pocketable, waterproof camera, this works great, and I wouldn't hesitate to use it when I don't want to carry a large dslr.

Reviews.Title: Gives up early
Reviews.Author: Mary C McConnell
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and my husband.  My niece had one also. All 3 have quit working.  They did not meet the expectation.  They were not used very much.  I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance, has weak points in case
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Jones
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to replace another that bit the dust (literally) while in Afghanistan.  I assumed that the ruggedized case would be a better fit for the dust, occasional stream crossing, vibrations, and general havoc of deployments.  I was right on those counts.  10 months later, the outside camera still looks fairly new.  However, there are some issues with it.Poor performance: this camera does well outside, focusing and taking a picture in usually around half a second.  Inside, however, is a totally different story.  With a flash or without, the camera had a hard time getting clear pictures.  It would spend an excessive time trying to focus (usually on what was not the subject) and then take a muddied picture at such a slow shutter speed that the picture was generally unusable.  If using a flash, there would be a lag of 2-3 seconds between pressing the shutter release and the camera firing.  Sometimes it would just refuse to take a picture.  There are many times I would have to have somebody else take a picture because the Fuji XP refused to.Weak points in case: I had the camera in my pocket one day and took it out to find that several of the buttons had been smashed in and were no longer usable.  So while the case can stand falls, water, etc., the buttons can't take the pressure from my thighs pushing it against the inside of my pocket.This camera is essentially trash after 10 months.  I'm not fooling with repairs or warranty service on a camera that performs so poorly anyway.  It's loaded full of virtually useless features but can't get the basics down: take good pictures (fast) and don't break.

Reviews.Title: Working for now...
Reviews.Author: YourNameHere
Reviews.Content: *EDIT: Raised to five stars - I have taken this camera on numerous trips now, fully submerged it repeatedly (never more than a foot) I have beaten the crap out of this camera and it keeps comming back for more. When closing the battery compartment make sure (as the manual says) that there is absolutely no yellow showing on the latch and you should be golden. At this point I cannot confirm the durability issues reported which nearly lead to me not purchasing this camera and have to attribute the complaints to opperator error.Figured I'd take a chance on this camera, I do a good bit of kayaking and was hoping I might get a decent waterproof with abit of optical zoom. First of all the image quality is good, I like the layout of the camera, and definitely like the one touch video. Good out of the way I have taken this out once, I don't do underwater photography but it's definitely going to get hit with water along the way. Then, according to the manual I rinsed/soaked it in clean water when I got home. Then hung it on a peg and went to get dinner quick, two hours later when reviewing the days shots water leaked out of the camera any time a button was pressed - and low and behold the area around the battery also had a few drops. The way the seals or designed that isn't a problem the antechamber can get wet without the battery/smart card getting wet but for the price of the camera I am not pleased with that. Audio playback from the camera is horrible but once the video is uploaded it's fine. It also boggles my mind you have to hold the power button a few seconds to turn it on but one bump will shut it off instantly.My final thoughts on this camera are that it's not bad but I don't have a ton of faith in it. I have used the Kodak C123 sport and find it takes far better pictures when moving and it has dual locking doors providing a higher level of confidence in it's waterproof(ness) and it's cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Fuji disappoints
Reviews.Author: Norberto Rivera
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I both bought this same camera and have used it for about a week now both indoors and out.  Photography is part of our job and we know enough to have an educated expectation of what a point-and-shoot camera can and cannot do.  This camera fails miserably in most situations we put it through.  The auto-focus is sluggish in both regular and macro modes.  The white balance doesn't seem to work correctly, yielding yellowish photographs inside a white room with white lighting in all white balance modes.  Simple indoor photographs with a flash of people from 4 feet away are blurry and very noisy.  The camera does not handle objects in motion well at all, even using the sports setting.  Judging from previous experience with a number of brands of digital cameras the XP20 seems to have serious firmware problems which I would totally not expect from Fuji.  The actual camera handled extremely dusty conditions very well but the software just doesn't capture and process the images very well at all.  Needless to say I will be returning this camera and going back to Olympus or Cannon for my point-and-shoot needs.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Spudinski
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife and she loves it.  Great pics and durable.  Highly recommend this if you are looking for a durable camera.  Be aware it DOESN'T come with a memory card.

Reviews.Title: Audio is out-of-sync
Reviews.Author: H. Wang "jwangamazon"
Reviews.Content: I got the Fuji XP20 mainly for taking videos in conditions that my Canon HD camcorder can not. On my first usage in a river rafting event, I already see the problems with this camera:1) I am experienced with Camera and camcorders, I know how to hold them properly. But the lens head is placed in a very awkward place, your fingers will easily cover part of the lens head. So, don't be surprised to see your fingers in the final photos and video clips. It's almost for sure that you will not get photos or videos of yourself. Because other people may not be able to hold this camera properly to take yours.2) Hard to fine tune the zoom speed. Not convenient, but I can live with that.3) The camera won't focus while zooming (it will focus after zooming stops). This is a typical issue with non-DSLR camera in video mode. I saw the same thing in Panasonic camera also. Not a big issue to me.4) This is the biggest flaw, the audio is not in sync with the video. I have to turn off the audio from the video clips, and add background music when producing the final movie for the rafting trip. Even my simple Flip video camera handle this better than this Fuji camera.5) The video quality is no way to compare with regular HD camcorder. The image is kind of grainy, even at 1pm strong sunshine with good light. Again, I can accept this since I am in a condition (around water) where normal camcorder can not be used.6) Indoor photo quality is no way to compare with my 5-year-old 5MP Panasonic camera.But this is OK to me since I am in a condition (around water) where my normal camera can not be used.If this is the only camera you want to have, I won't recommend this. However, if your intend is "ONLY" to take photos, videos in conditions where your normal gears can not, then I think this Fuju XP20 is acceptable....if you don't mind the out-of-sync audio problem.

Reviews.Title: Piece of JUNK, Amazon should stop selling FUJI Products
Reviews.Author: Olivia and Luiz Marques
Reviews.Content: This camera was the worse headache ever. It flooded 5 times and this last time FUJI wants $133, and the new camera is $149.The amount of money spend sending it back was ridiculous!This camera is NOT underwater,and is by far the worse camera on the market right now, Amazon should stop selling FUJI products, this company does not stand by their products, the customer service is almost non existent, they don't contact you when the camera arrives to be fixed and in one of the 5 times the technician said the the wherehouse was full of cameras to be fixed, we told him that he should not be saying that it makes FUJI look bad.DON'T BUY THiS CAMERA, READ THE OTHER REVIEWS IT IS HORRIBLE!!!

Reviews.Title: NOT waterproof and could be better overall...
Reviews.Author: 3 dogs, 1 kid mom
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a while, and it was ok at first. I didn't care much for the LED illumination feature and I just didn't think the colors were exactly true when photographing flowers (especially reds). Then I had problems with the teensy-tiny buttons used to lock the SD card in place. The camera was waterproof for about 3 snorkeling adventures, and then it came up flooded with water in the unit. Ok to use if you don't take it in the water, or if you use in a bag for underwater cameras...

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? Sorry but no...
Reviews.Author: Joel Stitzel "ladeedadee"
Reviews.Content: Mine died after just a few trips to the pool. The contacts around the battery are rusted. The camera internals are rusted. The usb port is rusted. There is a spot behind the front glass in front of the lens that clearly leaked water. I am sure I closed the thing properly. It has been a super disappointment and I am not sure whether to send for repair or the landfill. If you have yours out of warranty you could send it here:FUJIFILM North America Corporation1100 King Georges Post RoadEdison, NJ 08837Attn.: Repair Dept.Phone: (800) 659-3854 (x3461)Fax: (732) 857-3471 or (732) 857-3472Hours: 9:00 am - 8:00 pm EST

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I ever bought, worst company I ever dealt with...
Reviews.Author: Lost Boys
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these cameras, thinking that when the first one quit (under warranty) that it was a fluke. It wasn't. The second one leaked after only a few times using it, rendering it a total loss. Fugi offered to fix it for over $100 or upgrade it to a newer model for $159.+) I could buy a new one for that! However, based on my personal experience, I wouldn't want to. When I asked what they had changed on the numerous models since this one, I received the same answer- the door. Duh! It leaks! Based on the numerous door changes and similar reviews to mine, I suspect they know that and they should stand behind their product when they've made something that might have problems. I am never buying a FUJI camera again! If you make the choice to do so after reading all the negative reviews, be sure you buy a lengthy extended warranty. After this experience, I'll never buy an under water camera again without one!

Reviews.Title: Not very durrable
Reviews.Author: lwfoley
Reviews.Content: I've been through 4 of these cameras in 3 years, when they work they take good pictures. But they are not durrable.I would not buy another one

Reviews.Title: Fujiflim fine xp20
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera.  It has so many option when it comes to taking pictures.  There night mode, under water & etc.  I was looking for a camera would take pictures under water & this one fits my budget.  The picture quality is awesome.  I do own a expensive camera which I use when I'm on vacation; the only problem is that it's not water .  I would highly recommended this camera base on their price & functionality.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: R. Stewart
Reviews.Content: The flash on this thing took forever, not a good quality in a camera when your inspecting a house and need to take 200+ pictures.I had taken good care of this thing and one little drop from about a foot onto grass and this things out of commission. Now Im using some cheap digital kodak camera and have dropped it numerous times onto pavement and it works absolutely fine.This fujifilm FAILS in my book. If you plan on using this for outdoors and think at some point you could possibly drop your camera then dont get this because IT will break and very easily at that.

Reviews.Title: Fun Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Gardner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a back up camera for bad weather ( rainy days). I have played with it for about two weeks now and love it for what it is.I wanted to try it in the water so i took it surfing tucked it in the sleeve of my wet suit and took some really cool pictures and video with no problems. I see people complain it isnt water proof well it is and worked perfect for me in the ocean Even when i was getting pounded by the surf.For as cheap as this camera is priced the video is good the pictures are good I think better in water. If people want excellent HD video than buy an expensive hd video camera, Or professional pictures buy an expensive DSLR. This camera has lived up to its expectations. No complaints from me.

Reviews.Title: xp20 = expensive and not worth 20cents
Reviews.Author: bdmcdona
Reviews.Content: manual not very thorough, and unable to use pdf file to make pages larger for vision impairment. company not helpful, wants to sell me what I already have. no sound on videos, even though on volume 10. Battery doesn't last long, buttongs not clearly visable. Very very very disappointed, do not recommend for anyone.
